hangar inspect command allows to inspect the container image manifest (similar to skopeo inspect).
Hangar mirror/save/load/sync commands supports validate subcommands for validating the copied image.
The hangar convert-list command allows to convert image list format from default format to the mirror format (see image list format specification).

documents.t: This example will guide you to setup a multi-arch private image registry server for K3s Air-Gapped installation.
This example will guide you to setup a multi-arch private image registry server for RKE2 Air-Gapped installation.
This example will guide you to setup a multi-arch private image registry server for Rancher Air-Gapped installation.
Hangar is written in Golang.
Hangar docker images support both amd64 and arm64 architectures.
Hangar project source code includes unit tests and validation tests.
The hangar generate-list command allows to generate a Rancher image list and K8s cluster version list according to the Rancher Version.
You can run Hangar by using the Hangar Docker Image inside the container or install Hangar binary into your system.
You need to execute hangar login for SOURCE REGISTRY (if images in source registry are private) and DESTINATION REGISTRY before copying images.
The hangar load command loads images from zip archive file created by save command to registry server, it allows to upload container images to registry server without a public internet connection,
The hangar load validate command (subcommand of hangar load) is used for ensuring the images were loaded to registry server.
hangar mirror command supports two different kinds of image list formats:
About Hangar

hangar mirror command is for mirror multiple container images between image registry servers. It allows you to specify architecture and platforms when copying image, and use multiple workers to copy images parallelly.
The hangar mirror validate command (subcommand of hangar mirror) is used for ensuring the images were mirrored correctly.
The hangar save command is similar to the mirror command. It allows you to copy multiple container images into an archive file for load command use.
See Hangar Archive File specification for more detailed information about hangar archive.
The hangar save validate command (subcommand of hangar save) is used for ensuring the images were saved into archive file correctly.
Use hangar generate-sigstore-key to generate a sigstore key-pair for sign command use.
Hangar has built-in trivy‚Äôs container image scanning function. You can use hangar scan command for scanning multi-platform container image vulnerabilities.
hangar sign command is for signing container images with sigstore key-pair.
Use hangar sign validate command for validate the signed image sigstore signature.
The hangar sync command is similar to the save command, it allows you to sync (append) extra images into the archive file without re-downloading all images.
The hangar sync validate command (subcommand of hangar sync) is similar to save validate command. It is used for ensuring the extra images were added into archive file.
Versions‚Äã View the latest hangar release: https://github.com/cnrancher/hangar/releases Versions
Hangar mirror/save/load/sync commands supports validate subcommands for validating the copied image.
hangar inspect command allows to inspect the container image manifest (similar to skopeo inspect).
The hangar convert-list command allows to convert image list format from default format to the mirror format (see image list format specification).
The hangar completion command allows to generate shell completion scripts for different shells.

Follow this instruction to setup a demo distribution registry server and use Hangar to copy images. Setup a demo registry server. docker run -d -p 5000:5000 --restart=always --name registry registry:2 Run Hangar inside the container image: docker run -it -v $(pwd):/hangar --network=host cnrancher/hangar:latest Create an image list file for copy images from the Docker Hub to the demo registry server: example_image_list.txt cnrancher/hangar:latest cnrancher/hangar:v1.8.0 Use Hangar mirror command to copy images from Docker Hub to the demo registry server: hangar mirror \ -f 'example_image_list.txt' \ -s 'docker.io' \ -d '127.0.0.1:5000' \ --arch amd64,arm64 \ --os linux \ --tls-verify=false note By default, the registry server can be login with any username and password. You can configure the authentication config of the registry server by refer to Distribution Registry Token Authentication. Use the hangar inspect command to inspect the copied image manifest index: hangar inspect docker://127.0.0.1:5000/cnrancher/hangar:latest --raw --tls-verify=false { "mediaType": "application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.list.v2+json", "schemaVersion": 2, "manifests": [ { "mediaType": "application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.v2+json", ......

You can refer to the Installation Guide to install hangar on your system. For more detailed usage example of hangar to setup a private image registry server with Kubernetes clusters, see Hangar Best Practice.

The configuration file of hangar is compatible with the containers/image configuration files. /etc/containers/policy.json: The default trust policy file, use --insecure-policy option to skip policy check. The default policy file can be obtained at default-policy.json. /etc/containers/registries.d/default.yaml: The default registries configuration file.

mirror: Mirror container images between image registries. save: Save container images from registry server into archive file. load: Load container images from archive file to registry server. sync: Sync (append) extra images into archive file. sign: Sign container images with sigstore key-pair. scan: Scan container image vulnerabilities. archive: Operations for the Hangar archive file. generate-list: Generate image list file for Rancher. Hanagr also provides some extra commands for advanced usage, see advanced usage.

Hangar can work with API V2 container image registries: Registry Docker Hub, quay.io, ghcr.io Harbor 2.X Other Public Cloud infrastructure providers: AWS, Google Cloud, Tencent Cloud TCR, Alibaba Cloud ACR, etc... You need to ensure that the registry supports following mediaTypes: application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.list.v2+json application/vnd.oci.image.index.v1+json note Harbor 1.X does not support these mediaTypes, you need to upgrade to Harbor 2.X to use hangar.
For frequently asked questions, see Q&A.
The hangar completion command allows to generate shell completion scripts for different shells.

Execute following command to enable Hangar shell completion. For bash: echo 'source <(hangar completion bash)' >> ~/.bashrc && source ~/.bashrc For zsh: echo 'source <(hangar completion zsh)' >> ~/.zshrc && source ~/.zshrc

hangar completion --help Generate the autocompletion script for hangar for the specified shell. See each sub-command's help for details on how to use the generated script. Usage: hangar completion [command] Available Commands: bash Generate the autocompletion script for bash fish Generate the autocompletion script for fish powershell Generate the autocompletion script for powershell zsh Generate the autocompletion script for zsh Flags: -h, --help help for completion Global Flags: --debug enable debug output --insecure-policy run Hangar without policy check Use "hangar completion [command] --help" for more information about a command.
hangar inspect command allows to inspect the container image manifest (similar to skopeo inspect).

Use --raw option to view the container image RAW manifest index of nginx image on docker hub: hangar inspect --raw docker://nginx:latest Use --config option to view the container image config manifest of nginx image on docker hub: hangar inspect --config docker://nginx:latest

hangar inspect --help Inspect provides basic functions of 'skopeo inspect' to inspect image manifest Usage: hangar inspect IMAGR_REFERENCE [flags] Examples: # Inspect image manifest: hangar inspect [image-reference] # Inspect RAW docker image maniefest: hangar inspect docker://docker.io/cnrancher/hangar:latest --raw Flags: --config output raw configuration -h, --help help for inspect --override-arch string use ARCH instead of the architecture of the machine for choosing images --override-os string use OS instead of the running OS for choosing images --override-variant string use VARIANT instead of the running variant for choosing images --raw output raw manifest --tls-verify require HTTPS and verify certificates (default true) Global Flags: --debug enable debug output --insecure-policy run Hangar without policy check

Hangar mirror/save/load/sync commands supports validate subcommands for validating the copied image. Get the validate command document of each command in the form below. Command Validate mirror mirror validate save save validate load load validate sync sync validate

The hangar convert-list command allows to convert image list format from default format to the mirror format (see image list format specification). note The mirror command supports both default and mirror format image list files. You can use the mirror command to copy container images with the default format image list file directly.

Convert the list from default format to mirror format, and set the destination registry to example registry.example.io: Prepare an example image list in default format: example_image_list.txt docker.io/library/mysql:8 docker.io/library/nginx:latest Use following command to convert the image list from default format to mirror format and override the destination registry server to registry.example.io. hangar convert-list \ --input="example_image_list.txt" \ --output="example_mirror_list.txt" \ --source=docker.io \ --destination=registry.example.io The converted image list is like: example_mirror_list.txt docker.io/library/mysql registry.example.io/library/mysql 8 docker.io/library/nginx registry.example.io/library/nginx latest

Usage: hangar convert-list [flags] Examples: hangar convert-list -i rancher-images.txt -o CONVERTED_MIRROR_LIST.txt Flags: -d, --destination string specify the destination registry -h, --help help for convert-list -i, --input string input image list (required) -o, --output string output image list (default "[INPUT_FILE].converted") -s, --source string specify the source registry Global Flags: --debug enable debug output --tls-verify enable https tls verify (default true)
Hangar uses the zip format archive file since version v1.7.0.
The hangar archive ls command supports listing the images in the archive file.
